TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IRunningObjectTable

Docs.summary: Provides the managed definition of the interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can retrieve an interface to the running object table by calling the COM [GetRunningObjectTable](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163472) function.
For more information, see the documentation for the COM [IRunningObjectTable](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163473) interface in the MSDN library.
The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see [How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions](~/docs/framework/interop/how-to-map-hresults-and-exceptions.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void EnumRunning (out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IEnumMoniker ppenumMoniker);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EnumRunning([out] class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IEnumMoniker& ppenumMoniker) cil managed
Public Sub EnumRunning (ByRef ppenumMoniker As IEnumMoniker)
public: void EnumRunning([Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::Runtime::InteropServices::ComTypes::IEnumMoniker ^ % ppenumMoniker);
abstract member EnumRunning : IEnumMoniker -> unit

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains the new enumerator for the Running Object Table (ROT). This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Enumerates the objects currently registered as running.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the [IRunningObjectTable::EnumRunning](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163475) method in the MSDN library.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetObject (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker pmkObjectName, out object ppunkObject);

abstract member GetObject : System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker * obj -> int

Docs.param: A reference to the moniker to search for in the Running Object Table (ROT).
When this method returns, contains the requested running object. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Returns the registered object if the supplied object name is registered as running.
Docs.returns: An value that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the [IRunningObjectTable::GetObject](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163476) method in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: A reference to the moniker to search for in the Running Object Table (ROT).
When this object returns, contains the objects last change time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Searches for this moniker in the Running Object Table (ROT) and reports the recorded time of change, if present.
Docs.returns: An value that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the [IRunningObjectTable::GetTimeOfLastChange](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163477) method in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: A reference to the moniker to search for in the Running Object Table (ROT).
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified moniker is currently registered in the Running Object Table (ROT).
Docs.returns: An value that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

Docs.param: The Running Object Table (ROT) entry of the changed object.
A reference to the object's last change time.

abstract member Register : int * obj * System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IMoniker -> int

Docs.param: Specifies whether the Running Object Table's (ROT) reference to is weak or strong, and controls access to the object through its entry in the ROT.
A reference to the object being registered as running.
A reference to the moniker that identifies .
Docs.summary: Registers that the supplied object has entered the running state.
Docs.returns: A value that can be used to identify this ROT entry in subsequent calls to or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ROT references to `punkObject` (weak and strong) determine object lifetime. For more information, see the documentation for the COM [IRunningObjectTable::Register](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=163474) method in the MSDN library.
